item.title: “Living Mirrors” Exhibition Space Concept
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: “Living Mirrors” Exhibition Space Concept “Living Mirrors” is an avant-garde conceptual design project focused on form, materials, human interaction, and […]
item.content:encoded:
“Living Mirrors” Exhibition Space Concept

“Living Mirrors” is an avant-garde conceptual design project focused on form, materials, human interaction, and use of space. This project integrates cutting-edge technologies such as transparent OLED display and motion sensors with human senses to conceptualize an interactive exhibition space tailored to fit two people in the interactive spaces and 5-6 total guests.

Concept Description

The two portal like forms invite guests to come closer with their polished backface mirrors and deep walls, the form of the mirrors is distinctly sharp or rounded to represent fluidity and rigidity. As users cross the threshold and become enveloped in the forms, the hidden motion detectors activate transparent OLED screens on high quality mirrors to overlay effects. The use of design to influence guest behaviors paired with integrated technologies brings the mirrors to life and alters the guest’s perception of themselves. The options for user interaction with the mirrors can be updated by adjusting code that listens for guest movement and maps visual feedback to the transparent OLED display .

Programs Used

  • Adobe Dimension (rendering & styling objects)
  • Adobe Photoshop
  • Fusion 360 (object modeling)

Feasibility Precedents

  • XBOX Kinect Sensors and similar devices are feasible for motion detection, relaying information in integrated systems, and have great documentation for “hacking” them
  • Transparent OLED displays are existing, and developing, technologies that have proven functionality at varying dimensions

item.title: El Paso County Public Health Web Accessibility Improvements
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: El Paso County Public Health Web Accessibility Improvements El Paso County Public Health is based in Colorado Springs, Colorado and […]
item.content:encoded:
El Paso County Public Health Web Accessibility Improvements

El Paso County Public Health is based in Colorado Springs, Colorado and serves the estimated 735,822 residents of El Paso County and visitors. They wanted to improve the accessibility of the site pre-launch to better serve their communities and comply with Section 508.

Challenge

Applying global, scalable, site fixes for integrated design and development issues introduced by disparate page features.

What I Did

  • Performed automated and manual accessibility testing using latest WCAG 2.2 standards
  • Documented found accessibility issues including the “why”, the fix, and the estimated fix time
  • Remediated technical & design rooted failures by creating custom JavaScript functionalities
  • Efficiently debugged custom accessibility scripts for customizing rigid integrations lacking or improperly implementing accessibility features
  • Utilized strong familiarity with WCAG standards
  • efficient use of both automated testing & manual testing methods

Web Accessibility Tools Used

  • WCAG 2.2
  • Adobe Color’s accessibility tool
  • Lighthouse
  • WAVE Evaluation Tool
  • Chrome inspector and local overrides

item.title: “Slow Integration Coaching” Rebranding Assistance
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: “Slow Integration Coaching” Rebranding Assistance Sarah Rimmel (She/They), the owner, is committed to cultivating ease, awareness of DE&I, and offers […]
item.content:encoded:
“Slow Integration Coaching” Rebranding Assistance

Sarah Rimmel (She/They), the owner, is committed to cultivating ease, awareness of DE&I, and offers somatic coaching for individuals or teams. Sarah wanted assistance with rebranding the practice, design, marketing, video editing, and accessibility support.

Values Alignment

Rebranding started with learning about Sarah and her practice to learn what values their coaching practice embodies and what their business goals are for rebranding. These conversations yielded valuable insights, highlighting the significance of natural, cultural, and somatic awareness.

Designing a New Custom Script Logo

During discussions, Sarah repeatedly mentioned the symbolism of finding joy in all the little things during hard times, like a beautiful stone, or a leaf with a perfect frost layer. We explored options for typography and landed on creating a custom script logo to best present their values after reviewing draft typography options.

This logo is adapted from Sarah’s own handwriting to add a personal touch, key design choices such as the form of the “o’s integrate the symbolism of natural flow and ease.

General Design

I helped guide alignment between design strategies and business objectives, establishing accessible style guidelines and crafting marketing assets. Additionally, I provided resources to facilitate Sarah’s understanding of design principles and web accessibility.

Regular deliverables included sticker designs, social media post marketing assets, marketing handout formatting, and accessible video editing.

item.title: Plateau Excavation Redesign Implementation
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: Plateau Excavation Redesign Implementation Plateau Excavation is one of the Southeast’s largest site infrastructure contractors specializing in industrial, e-commerce, and […]
item.content:encoded:
Plateau Excavation Redesign Implementation

Plateau Excavation is one of the Southeast’s largest site infrastructure contractors specializing in industrial, e-commerce, and other services. Plateau wanted assistance implementing high fidelity wireframes and features on their WordPress site.

*I do not currently maintain this site’s content, please consider some updates have occurred since launch

Challenge

Adapting WordPress theme elements with rigid properties to align with wireframe specifications, like overlaying elements not inherently supported by the theme, while maintaining responsiveness and keeping the pages simple to edit by non-technical folks.

What I Did

  • Implemented style guide
  • Applied content to homepage & internal pages
  • Implemented low and high-fidelity wireframes
  • Responsive design & development
  • Quality assurance testing & remediation
  • Team bio modal functionality

Page Examples

  • Homepage implementation
  • What We Do implementation

item.title: “Serotonin”: A Visual Sound Experience
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: “Serotonin”: A Visual Sound Experience An embodiment of what brings me serotonin: loud music & conversation, the warmth of the […]
item.content:encoded:
“Serotonin”: A Visual Sound Experience

An embodiment of what brings me serotonin: loud music & conversation, the warmth of the sun, that fuzziness you see when you give your eyes a good rub in the morning.

Brought to life with creative coding using a js library, p5.js, and the need for expression. “Serotonin” invites the viewer through interactive sounds and visuals to take a moment for wonder, play, and music.

“Serotonin” uses the viewer’s microphone to pick up on sounds like conversation and music. The dynamic volume of the viewer’s environment transforms, and at times distorts, the scene.

Click here to interact with “Serotonin” , press the red play button to start the script, allow microphone usage, and make some noise!

*Demo video audio credit: AlisiaBeats
*Privacy: This experience does not store audio or any user information, it just detects noise levels using the microphone

Resources to Remix Project

  • Edit “Serotonin” p5.js – Can create copy of my code
  • Map Making Reference p5.js – Can create copy of sketch and experiment with the code I adapted/extended

item.title: Brasserie Ten Ten User-Friendly “Menus” Editing Functionality
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: Brasserie Ten Ten User-Friendly “Menus” Editing Functionality Brasserie Ten Ten is a Parisian style brasserie in Boulder, Colorado, offering fine […]
item.content:encoded:
Brasserie Ten Ten User-Friendly “Menus” Editing Functionality

Brasserie Ten Ten is a Parisian style brasserie in Boulder, Colorado, offering fine cuisine. Brasserie wanted a simpler menu PDF update process to replace the previous tedious menu page content edits.

*The word “Menus” refers to the main-navigation item “Menus” & its sub-navigation items

The Challenge

Developing an intuitive method for non-technical users to update “Menus” sub-navigation items within the framework of the WordPress theme and platform.

What I Did

  • Created WordPress “PDF Menus” admin options page for uploading PDF menus with required custom fields: Menu Name, Menu PDF, and Menu Background Image.
    • *The features requiring “Menu Background Image” have not been launched yet
  • Created “Menu Editor” user role they can assign to staff members so they can only edit the “Menus” sub-navigation items
  • Custom field integration for “PDF Menus” option page
  • Developed PHP function for deceivingly simple front-end updates with the push of the “publish” button on the options page by integrating custom fields and WordPress functions

Key Features

  • Output script conditionals for not displaying incomplete update items
  • User-friendly admin page name & input labels
  • Ability to quickly re-order “Menus” items by drag & dropping
  • Menu editor role specific limited admin options & simpler interface
  • Ability to scale and maintain “Menus” sub-nav items

item.title: Shelton Capital CIO Minute Videos
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: Shelton Capital CIO Minute Videos Shelton Capital Management is focused on providing excellent investment options to individuals, financial advisors and […]
item.content:encoded:
Shelton Capital CIO Minute Videos

Shelton Capital Management is focused on providing excellent investment options to individuals, financial advisors and employer-sponsored retirement plans. Shelton wanted video editing support for creating compelling “CIO Minute” updates to inform investors of developing trends.

*Links to Shelton Funds’ CIO Minute examples are not me recommending financial advice, purpose is only to give examples of video editing services provided

The Challenge

Making additional requested edits within the same allotted timeline on occasion, self-managing editing priorities within timeline, and maintaining consistency despite variations in source video and audio quality.

What I Did

  • Provide Support for Six Months, Ending in December 2023
  • Adapted Existing Premiere Project Templating to Create videos
  • Sound Quality Improvements
  • Editing for Smooth Playback
  • Video Quality & Color Adjustment Improvements
  • Video Transformation & Background Blur/Replacement

Example Videos

  • Shelton Capital CIO Minute – September 28, 2023
  • Shelton Capital CIO Minute – August 23, 2023

item.title: Chevron Studio Re-Design
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: Chevron Studio Re-Design Chevron Studio, a collaboration between Chevron Technology Ventures and the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL), empowers entrepreneurs […]
item.content:encoded:
Chevron Studio Re-Design

Chevron Studio, a collaboration between Chevron Technology Ventures and the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL), empowers entrepreneurs to transform low-carbon technologies from labs and universities into successful startups through three phases of support. Chevron and NREL wanted to transition from a simple static site to a more robust, informative, dynamic site.

The Challenge

Navigating robust brand guidelines, managing dual stakeholder needs, and addressing pre-launch issues within tight timelines.

What I did

  • Internal Page Design
    • Created News Landing Style
    • Created News Single Page Style
    • Refinement of Cohorts Page Styles
  • Quality Assurance Testing & Remediation
  • Performed Requested Style & Content Edits
  • Responsive Design Styling Refinement
  • Utilized Chevron’s Brand Guidelines
  • Created Google Analytics 4 Property & Connected to Site
  • Installed & Configured Cookie Consent
  • Implemented Accessibility Features

item.title: Shelton Funds NASDX 100 Landing Page
item.dc:creator: cade_ponder
item.description: Shelton Funds NASDX 100 Landing Page Shelton Capital Management is focused on providing excellent investment options to individuals, financial advisors […]
item.content:encoded:
Shelton Funds NASDX 100 Landing Page

Shelton Capital Management is focused on providing excellent investment options to individuals, financial advisors and employer-sponsored retirement plans. Shelton wanted a single informative landing page to hype up, and focus on, the NASDAQ 100 Index Fund.

*I do not currently maintain this page’s content, please consider some updates have occurred since launch

The Challenge

Developing branding elements for new features that were distinct from the main site’s design system while maintaining cohesion, aiming to separate the sub-site page from the main site to emphasize the NASDX 100 Index Fund over the company.

What I did

  • Navigated Creation of Cohesive Brand Extended Design Elements
  • Implemented Design & Custom Functionality Within Limitations of the Content Management System
  • Implemented Responsive Design & Testing
  • Created Google Analytics 4 Property, Configured Custom Events, & Connected to Page
  • Interpreted Client Goals from Provided Site Examples, Main Site Design, & Design Feedback
  • Information Architecture

Key Features

  • Custom Content Navigation
  • Custom Header & Main Navigation
  • Key Information, Navigation, & Actions as Above the Fold Content
  • Dynamic Tables
